name: Digest new YouTube videos to Slack with Google Sheets, RapidAPI & GPT-4o-mini

user.name: Naveen Choudhary
user.bio: I create AI-driven n8n workflows that turn repetitive tasks into smooth, hands-off automations. Want to explore an idea? Book a quick consult: https://cal.com/nickchoudhary/30min

description:
## Who is this for?

Marketing, content, and enablement teams that need a **quick, human-readable summary of every new video** published by the YouTube channels they care about‚Äîwithout leaving Slack.

## What problem does this workflow solve?

Manually checking multiple channels, skimming long videos, and pasting the highlights into Slack wastes time. This template **automates the whole loop**: detect a fresh upload from your selected channels ‚Üí pull subtitles ‚Üí distill the key take-aways with GPT-4o-mini ‚Üí drop a neatly-formatted digest in Slack.

## What this workflow does

1. **Schedule Trigger** fires every 10 min, then grabs a list of YouTube RSS feeds from a Google Sheet.
2. **HTTP + XML** fetch & parse each feed; only brand-new videos continue.
3. **YouTube API** fetches title/description, **RapidAPI** grabs English subtitles.
4. Code nodes build an AI payload; **OpenAI** returns a JSON summary + article.
5. A formatter turns that JSON into Slack Block Kit, and **Slack** posts it.
6. Processed links are appended back to the ‚ÄúVideo Links‚Äù sheet to prevent dupes.

## Setup

1. **Make a copy** of this [Google Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1i3jZ_0npsEVtrMUSzGPV3Lbta3q7sArHHeNomlAuSMg/edit?usp=sharing) and connect a **Google Sheets OAuth2** credential with edit rights.
2. **Slack App**: create ‚Üí add `chat:write`, `channels:read`, `app_mention`; enable Event Subscriptions; install and store the **Bot OAuth token** in an n8n Slack credential.
3. **RapidAPI key** for `https://yt-api.p.rapidapi.com/subtitles` (300 free calls/mo) ‚Üí save as HTTP Header Auth.
4. **OpenAI key** ‚Üí save in an OpenAI credential.
5. Add your RSS feed URLs to the ‚ÄúRSS Feed URLs‚Äù tab; press *Execute Workflow*.

## How to customise

* Adjust the schedule interval or freshness window in **‚ÄúIf newly published‚Äù**.
* Swap the OpenAI model or prompt for shorter/longer digests.
* Point the Slack node at a different channel or DM.
* Extend the AI payload to include thumbnails or engagement stats.

## Use-case ideas

* **Product marketing**: Instantly brief sales & CS teams when a competitor uploads a feature demo.
* **Internal learning hub**: Auto-summarise conference talks and share bullet-point notes with engineers.
* **Social media managers**: Get ready-to-post captions and key moments for re-purposing across platforms.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

parameters.content:
## 1. Trigger & Source
- **Kick-off every 10 min**  
  Starts the workflow on a timer so you‚Äôre always working with fresh data.

- **Grab feed list from Google Sheet**  
  Pulls the latest RSS URLs so you can add or remove sources without touching the flow.

## 2. Fetch & Batch
- **Process one feed at a time**  
  Keeps memory low and makes retry logic straightforward.

- **HTTP GET to download each RSS**  
  Grabs raw XML content for the next step.

## 3. Parse & Filter
- **Convert XML ‚Üí JSON**  
  Translates RSS into clean JSON objects the rest of the flow can read.

- **Keep only brand-new items**  
  Drops anything older than your freshness window so you never double-post.

parameters.text:
={{ $json.blocks }}


You can check the full video here üëâ {{ $('Check for new videos').first().json.link.href }}

parameters.content:
## 4. Enrich & Summarize
- **Pull video details + subtitles**  
  Adds title, description, and transcript data for richer context.

- **Send to AI for short summary**  
  Generates a concise, readable recap ready for sharing.

## 5. Log & Notify
- **Append new videos to sheet**  
  Records what‚Äôs already been handled to prevent duplicates.

- **Post summary to Slack**  
  Drops the final digest into your channel so the team sees updates in real time.

parameters.text: =Check if {{ $json.rss_feed_url }} is already available in the sheets using `Get Rows` Google Sheets tool. If it's there, do nothing. If it's not in the sheet, then based on the user message {{ $('Slack Trigger').item.json.text }} "add" or "remove" it to the sheets using `Append Row` and `Delete Row` Google Sheets tools accordingly.

options.systemMessage:
You are an automation assistant managing RSS feed entries in a Google Sheet.

1. First, check if `{{ $json.rss_feed_url }}` exists in the sheet using the `Get Rows` node.
2. If the URL **already exists**:
   - Do **nothing** unless the Slack message contains "remove", in which case delete the corresponding row using `Delete Row`.
3. If the URL **does not exist**:
   - If the Slack message (`{{ $('Slack Trigger').item.json.text }}`) contains "add", use `Append Row` to insert the URL.
   - If the message contains "remove", do **nothing**.

Only act if the intent ("add" or "remove") is clearly mentioned in the Slack message.

parameters.startIndex: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Start_Row_Number', "Get `row_number` from `Get Rows` to determine which row to delete", 'number') }}

parameters.content:
## 1. Slack Event Trigger
- Kicks off whenever someone @mentions the bot in a channel, capturing the message text and channel context.

### Example:
"@yourbotname, add this  `https://www.youtube.com/@mreflow`"

"@yourbotname, delete/remove this  `https://www.youtube.com/@mreflow`"

## 2. Build RSS & Decide Action
- Extracts the YouTube channel link from the message, converts it into a channel-specific RSS URL, and lets an AI step read the text to decide whether the user wants to **add** or **remove** that feed.

## Setting up Slack OAuth for Posting & Event Listening

1. **Create a Slack App**: `api.slack.com/apps` ‚Üí **Create New App** ‚Üí ‚ÄúFrom scratch.‚Äù  
2. **Add Bot Token Scopes**:  
   - `chat:write` (post messages)  
   - `channels:read` & `groups:read` (find channel IDs)  
3. **Enable Event Subscriptions**:  
   - Turn on **Event Subscriptions** ‚Üí set your n8n public webhook URL.  
   - Subscribe to the **`app_mention`** event so the bot fires when mentioned.  
4. **Install the App**: Click **Install App**, authorize, and copy the **Bot User OAuth Token** (`xoxb-...`) into an n8n Slack credential.  
5. **Invite Bot to Channel**: `/invite @YourBot` in the target channel.  
6. **Test**: Send ‚Äú`@YourBot add/remove {YouTube Channel link}`‚Äù and watch the workflow update the sheet.

*(If you change scopes later, reinstall the app so the token picks up new permissions.)*

## üîë Setup & Credentials
- **Google Sheets Template**  
  > Make a copy of the master sheet here:  
  > `https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1i3jZ_0npsEVtrMUSzGPV3Lbta3q7sArHHeNomlAuSMg/edit?usp=sharing`  
  > Connect the copy with a **Google Sheets OAuth2** credential that has **edit** access so the workflow can read/write rows.

- **RapidAPI ‚Äì Subtitles Endpoint**  
  > Sign up at `https://yt-api.p.rapidapi.com/subtitles` (free 300 calls / month).  
  > Store your **X-RapidAPI-Key** in an n8n **Header Auth** credential‚Äînever hard-code it in the node.

- **OpenAI API Key**  
  > Create a key at `https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys` and save it in an n8n **OpenAI** credential.  
  > Monitor usage; long transcripts can eat tokens quickly.
